title: Creating a reading list on commonsense reasoning involves selecting articles that cover a range of topics, including foundational theories, computational models, and applications in artificial intelligence. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"A Logic-Based Calculus of Events"** by Robert Kowalski and Marek Sergot (1986) - A foundational paper on representing events and actions in logic
- A comprehensive book that covers various aspects of commonsense reasoning in AI

container-title: **"The Frame Problem in Artificial Intelligence: Proceedings of the 1987 Workshop"**
title: - A collection of papers discussing the frame problem, a central issue in commonsense reasoning
- A collection of essays on formal approaches to commonsense reasoning
**"Commonsense Knowledge Representation"** by Ernest Davis
- A book that explores how to represent commonsense knowledge in AI systems
- Discusses a framework for reasoning about physical systems in a commonsense way
- A seminal paper on the need for AI systems to incorporate commonsense knowledge about the physical world
- A paper by one of the pioneers of AI discussing the importance of commonsense reasoning
**"CYC: A Large-Scale Investment in Knowledge Infrastructure"** by Douglas B
- Describes the CYC project, an ambitious attempt to encode commonsense knowledge
- Introduces the concept of the knowledge level, which is crucial for understanding commonsense reasoning
**"A Review of the Winograd Schema Challenge: Toward Human-Level Commonsense Reasoning"** by
- Discusses a benchmark for evaluating commonsense reasoning in AI
**"Commonsense Reasoning and Commonsense Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence"** by Ernest Davis and Gary Marcus
- A review article on the state of commonsense reasoning in AI
- Proposes a new test for AI systems based on commonsense reasoning
**"Commonsense Knowledge and Commonsense Reasoning: Some Philosophical Perspectives"** by John McCarthy
- Explores philosophical issues related to commonsense reasoning
**"The Role of Commonsense Knowledge in Language Processing"** by Jerry R
- Discusses how commonsense knowledge is essential for understanding natural language
**"Commonsense Reasoning: An Event Calculus Based Approach"** by Erik T
- Explores the use of event calculus in modeling commonsense reasoning
**"Commonsense Reasoning about Causality: Deriving Behavior from Structure"** by Johan de Kleer and John Seely Brown
- Discusses reasoning about causality in a commonsense manner
- Explores the hypothesis that knowledge representation is central to AI
- Discusses the role of commonsense reasoning in understanding language
**"Commonsense Reasoning and Commonsense Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence"** by Ernest Davis and Gary Marcus
- A comprehensive review of the challenges and approaches in the field
These articles and books provide a broad overview of the field and cover various approaches and challenges in commonsense reasoning
